purpose_overview.goal: Promote lean muscle hypertrophy with minimal fat gain
purpose_overview.approach: Moderate caloric surplus (10–20%) prioritizing whole, nutrient-dense foods
scientific_basis: Supports progressive overload training by supplying energy and macronutrients
Minimizes excess fat accumulation while promoting lean mass

caloric_strategy.maintenance_calculation: Estimate TDEE using Mifflin-St Jeor or Cunningham equation
caloric_strategy.surplus: Add 10–20% (~250–500 kcal/day) and adjust weekly based on weight trends

rationale.protein: Maximizes muscle protein synthesis (Morton et al., 2018)
rationale.carbohydrates: Restores glycogen and fuels training (Kerksick et al., 2017)
rationale.fats: Supports hormones and fat-soluble vitamin absorption

meal_timing_distribution.protein_distribution: 20–40 g per meal spaced every 3–5 hr

pre_workout.2_3_hours_before: Complex carbs + lean protein (e.g., chicken, rice, vegetables)
pre_workout.30_60_min_before: Optional simple carbs for energy boost

meal_timing_distribution.post_workout: Within 2 hr: 20–40 g protein + 1–1.5 g/kg carbs
meal_timing_distribution.hydration: 35–45 ml water/kg/day; include electrolytes if sweating heavily

supplements_optional.name: Creatine Monohydrate
supplements_optional.evidence: Strong evidence for increased strength and lean mass

supplements_optional.name: Vitamin D
supplements_optional.note: Use if intake or sun exposure is low

supplements_optional.name: Omega-3
supplements_optional.note: Support overall health if dietary intake is insufficient

monitoring_adjustments.body_weight: Track weekly averages and adjust calories based on trends
monitoring_adjustments.strength_progress: Reassess calories/training load if strength stagnates
monitoring_adjustments.body_composition: Check every 4–6 weeks using skinfolds, bioimpedance, or photos

advantages: Minimizes fat gain compared to aggressive bulks
Sustainable and flexible for long-term adherence
limitations: Slower visible muscle gain compared to dirty bulks
Requires tracking calories and macros initially
Demands patience and consistent training stimulus
references: Morton RW et al. (2018). Br J Sports Med, 52(6):376-384.
Kerksick CM et al. (2017). J Int Soc Sports Nutr, 14:33.
Slater GJ & Phillips SM (2011). J Sports Sci, 29 Suppl 1:S67–77.
American College of Sports Medicine (2022). Nutrition and Athletic Performance Position Stand.
